item.title: Matthew add a quote by Alice Notley
item.description: "We name us and then we are lost, tamed I choose words, more words, to cure the tameness, not the wildness" -- Alice Notley

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "If you're trapped in the dream of the Other, you're fucked." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Roberto Bolano
item.description: "Books are finite, sexual encounters are finite, but the desire to read and to fuck is infinite; it surpasses our own deaths, our fears, our hopes for peace." -- Roberto Bolano

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jacques Lacan
item.description: "The real is what resists symbolization absolutely." -- Jacques Lacan

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Knut Hamsun
Matthew add a quote by Laura Riding
item.description:
"People will think you brilliant only if you tell them what they know. To avoid being thought brilliant, avoid knowing what they know. Write to discover to yourself what you know.
Anarchism is Not Enough" -- Laura Riding

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "Writing has nothing to do with meaning. It has to do with landsurveying and cartography, including the mapping of countries yet to come." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "God and the imagination are one." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "The imagination loses vitality as it ceases to adhere to what is real." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "I've developed a great reputation for wisdom by ordering more books than I ever had time to read, and reading more books, by far, than I learned anything useful from, except, of course, that some very tedious gentlemen have written books." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jacques Lacan
item.description: "But what Freud showed us… was that nothing can be grasped, destroyed, or burnt, except in a symbolic way, as one says, in effigie, in absentia." -- Jacques Lacan

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Aase Berg
item.description: "Poetry is a will to put things right, an imaginary solution, a way of avoiding a catastrophe that already happened. Poetry is an escape, perhaps intelligent, perhaps idiotic, from a senile situation. It is a dialectical movement, it keeps tearing open the wounds while trying to heal them. Here we see the only acceptable path open up towards an existence worthy of human beings. Here the seriousness is unfaltering and absolute. Where it will lead no one knows." -- Aase Berg

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Aase Berg
item.description: "I don’t think dreams mean anything; they just are. There’s no reason to translate them into logic." -- Aase Berg

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Novalis
item.description: "Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason." -- Novalis

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Mina Loy
item.description: "The flux of life is pouring its aesthetic aspect into your eyes, your ears - and you ignore it because you are looking for your canons of beauty in some sort of frame or glass case or tradition." -- Mina Loy

item.title: Matthew add a quote by C.D. Wright
item.description: "I am suggesting that the radical of poetry lies not in the resolution of doubts but in their proliferation" -- C.D. Wright

item.title: Matthew add a quote by C.D. Wright
item.description: "Uniformity, in its motives, its goals, its far-ranging consequences, is the natural enemy of poetry, not to mention the enemy of trees, the soil, the exemplary life therein." -- C.D. Wright

item.title: Matthew add a quote by C.D. Wright
item.description: "Almost none of the poetries I admire stick to their labels, native or adopted ones. Rather, they are vagrant in their identifications. Tramp poets, there you go, a new label for those with unstable allegiances." -- C.D. Wright

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Emanuel Lasker
item.description: "Without error there can be no brilliancy" -- Emanuel Lasker

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Emanuel Lasker
item.description: "When you see a good move, look for a better one" -- Emanuel Lasker
